snippet: Institutional Shareholder Services, the prominent proxy advisory firm, told clients in a note on Sunday that they should vote against Carl Icahn’s proposal calling for a $50 billion stock buyback.
abstract: Institutional Shareholder Services, the prominent proxy advisory firm, told clients in a note on Sunday that they should vote against Carl Icahn’s proposal calling for a $50 billion stock buyback.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: I.S.S. Sides With Apple in Battle Against Icahn
